intro: Keyserlingia hortensis, commonly known as the garden keyserlingia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Keyserlingia hortensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and botanical collections.
